download internetAddress to globalContainerThis command starts a download of the contents of the URL given in internetAddress and, as the data arrives over the network, progressively writes it into the container given in globalContainer. The download happens in the background, while other scripts continue executing, as such the container given must be one that exists beyond the duration of the current handler, like a global variable or a text field. If you need to do something with the downloaded data besides displaying it in a text field, you can ask to be notified on completion in the following form:
download internetAddress to globalContainer when done commandor
download internetAddress to globalContainer when done command
or
download internetAddress to globalContainer when done commands end download or
download internetAddress to globalContainer when done commands end download
Similarly, you can also be notified of the arrival of each new chunk of data, as it is transferred over the network:
download internetAddress to globalContainer for each chunk command or
download internetAddress to globalContainer for each chunk command or
download internetAddress to globalContainer for each chunk commands end download or
download internetAddress to globalContainer for each chunk commands end download
You can also combine both forms to be notified of each time new data arrives, and when the download has completed:
download internetAddress to globalContainer for each chunk commands when done commands end download
etc.
the download the download the totalSize of the download element "User-Agent" of the headers of the download
Additional information on a download that is in progress is available to code inside the for each chunk or when done sections through the the download array. Currently, it contains the following keys:
totalSize The size the download will have when finished, in bytes. May be -1 to indicate we won’t know until the download has finished. size The amount of data downloaded so far, in bytes. statusCode The HTTP status code the web server returned, like 200 for success, or 404 for ‘file not found’. statusMessage A plain-text description of the statusCode, if available. address The URL of the file downloaded. This is the same as the internetAddress you gave to the download command. headers An array containing the headers in the reply from the server, with the header name as the key, and the header value is the value associated with that key.
